sentence.text: Pyridoxine 5*-phosphate oxidase (PNPO) is an enzyme that converts pyridoxine 5*-phosphate into pyridoxal 5*-phosphate (PLP), an active form of vitamin B6 implicated in several types of cancer.
However, the role of PNPO and its regulatory mechanism in epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) are unknown.
In the present study, PNPO expression in human ovarian tumour tissue and its association with the clinicopathological features of patients with EOC were examined.
Xenografts of PNPO-shRNA-expressing cells into the nude mouse attenuated tumour growth.
